      Parameters:

      Returns:
      A form to register an event.

      Parameters:

    • registerGameStatusForm

      @GetMapping("/register/gameStatus") public String registerGameStatusForm(@RequestParam(name="name") String name, @RequestParam(name="type") int type, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      If the game exists, and the game hasn't ended, and the game has begun, and the event type is correct, then return the form to register the event
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the game
      type - 0 - beginning, 1 - ending, 2 - pause, 3 - resume
      model - the model that will be used to render the view
      redirAttrs - RedirectAttributes is a Spring object that allows us to pass attributes to the next request.
      Returns:
      A form to register a game status event.

    • registerGameStatusSubmit

      @PostMapping("/register/gameStatus") public String registerGameStatusSubmit(@ModelAttribute GameStatusForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It takes a form, checks if the game exists, and if it does, it creates a new event and adds it to the database
      Parameters:
      form - the form object that is used to collect the data from the form.
      model - The model object that is used to store data that will be used by the view.
      redirAttrs - RedirectAttributes is a Spring object that allows you to add attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A string

    • registerGoalForm

      @GetMapping("/register/goal") public String registerGoalForm(@RequestParam(name="name") String name, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      If the game exists, and it hasn't ended, and it has begun, and the most recent event isn't an interruption, then show the form to register a goal
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the game
      model - the model that will be used to render the view
      redirAttrs - RedirectAttributes is a class that allows us to add attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A form to register a goal event.

    • registerGoalSubmit

      @PostMapping("/register/goal") public String registerGoalSubmit(@ModelAttribute GoalForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It takes a form, checks if the game exists, checks if the player exists, checks if the player has already received a red card, and if all of those are true, it registers the goal
      Parameters:
      form - The form object that is used to get the data from the form.
      model - The model is a Map of key-value pairs that will be passed to the view.
      redirAttrs - RedirectAttributes is a Spring object that allows you to add attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A redirect to the register page.

    • registerCardForm

      @GetMapping("/register/card") public String registerCardForm(@RequestParam(name="name") String name, @RequestParam(name="isYellow") boolean isYellow, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It gets the game name and the card color from the request parameters, checks if the game exists, if it has already ended, if it has already begun, if the last event wasn't an interruption. If all of these conditions are met, it returns the registerCard view
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the game
      isYellow - boolean that indicates if the card is yellow or red
      model - the model that will be used to render the view
      redirAttrs - used to send a message to the user
      Returns:
      A form to register a card event.

    • registerCardSubmit

      @PostMapping("/register/card") public String registerCardSubmit(@ModelAttribute CardForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It registers a card event.
      Parameters:
      form - the form that is used to register a card event
      model - The model object that is used to pass data to the view.
      redirAttrs - RedirectAttributes is a Spring object that allows you to pass attributes to the next request.
      Returns:
      A string
